org.gbif.occurrencestore.persistence.api

Interface OccurrenceKeyPersistenceService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OccurrenceKeyPersistenceServiceImpl

    public interface OccurrenceKeyPersistenceService
    This service manages the secondary index that links unique identifiers (either holy triplet or publisher-provided unique ids) to GBIF-generated occurrence keys (integers). It is also responsible for the generation of those GBIF occurrence keys. TODO: the KeyPersistenceService class is very similar to this and adds confusion - they should be combined

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteKey(int occurrenceKey, String datasetKey)
      Deletes the secondary index entry(ies) in the lookup table for the given occurrence key.
      void deleteKeyByUniqueIdentifiers(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
      Deletes the secondary index entry(ies) in the lookup table for the given UniqueIdentifiers.
      KeyLookupResult findKey(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
      Given a set of UniqueIdentifiers, fetch the GBIF-generated occurrence key for this occurrence from the occurrence key lookup table, if it exists.
      Set<Integer> findKeysByDataset(String datasetKey)
      Given a datasetKey, fetch the GBIF-generated occurrence keys for its occurrences (if any).
      KeyLookupResult generateKey(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
      If a key already exists for these uniqueIdentifiers, returns the existing key, otherwise generates a new key.

    • Method Detail

      • findKey

        @Nullable
KeyLookupResult findKey(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
        Given a set of UniqueIdentifiers, fetch the GBIF-generated occurrence key for this occurrence from the occurrence key lookup table, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifiers - the set of UniqueIdentifiers that describe this occurrence
        Returns:
        a KeyLookupResult containing the occurrence key if found, null otherwise
        Throws:
        org.gbif.api.exception.ServiceUnavailableException - if the underlying data connection fails

      • findKeysByDataset

        Set<Integer> findKeysByDataset(String datasetKey)
        Given a datasetKey, fetch the GBIF-generated occurrence keys for its occurrences (if any).
        Parameters:
        datasetKey - the dataset for which to find occurrence keys
        Returns:
        a set of occurrence keys found (if any)
        Throws:
        org.gbif.api.exception.ServiceUnavailableException - if the underlying data connection fails

      • generateKey

        KeyLookupResult generateKey(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
        If a key already exists for these uniqueIdentifiers, returns the existing key, otherwise generates a new key.
        Returns:
        the existing occurrence key if found, a new key otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the set is empty
        org.gbif.api.exception.ServiceUnavailableException - if the underlying data connection fails

      • deleteKey

        void deleteKey(int occurrenceKey,
             @Nullable
             String datasetKey)
        Deletes the secondary index entry(ies) in the lookup table for the given occurrence key.
        Parameters:
        occurrenceKey - the key to delete
        datasetKey - without the datasetKey the deletion will do a full table scan of lookups (very slow)
        Throws:
        org.gbif.api.exception.ServiceUnavailableException - if the underlying data connection fails

      • deleteKeyByUniqueIdentifiers

        void deleteKeyByUniqueIdentifiers(Set<UniqueIdentifier> uniqueIdentifiers)
        Deletes the secondary index entry(ies) in the lookup table for the given UniqueIdentifiers.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIdentifiers - corresponding to the lookup entries to delete
